questions.text: If the zeroes of the quadratic polynomial ax² + bx + c, c ≠ 0 are equal, then:
options: c and a have opposite signs
c and b have opposite signs
c and a have same signs
c and b have same signs
questions.answer: (c) c and a have same signs
questions.explanation: For equal roots, b² - 4ac = 0 => b² = 4ac. Since b² is always positive, 4ac must be positive, so a and c must have same signs.

questions.text: The zeroes of the quadratic polynomial x² + 99x + 127 are:

(ii) Find the number of zeroes if the graph cuts x-axis at 3 points.
(iii) If sum of zeroes is 2 and product is -8, write the polynomial.
